FuncDef:
The bgp dynamic-session-limit command configures a maximum number for dynamic BGP peer sessions.
The undo bgp dynamic-session-limit command restores the default configuration. The bgp dynamic-session-limit command configures a maximum number for dynamic BGP peer sessions. The undo bgp dynamic-session-limit command restores the default configuration. By default, the maximum number of dynamic BGP peer sessions is 100.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a maximum number for dynamic BGP peer sessions.
The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 16000.

ExtraInfo: The dynamic BGP peer function enables BGP to listen for BGP connection requests from a specified network segment, dynamically establish BGP peer relationships, and add these peers to the same dynamic peer group. This spares you from adding or deleting BGP peer configurations in response to each change in dynamic peers. To configure a maximum number for dynamic BGP peer sessions, run the bgp dynamic-session-limit command.
